messages.subject: AC-CENT-TCHU-ATE...
messages.msgSnippet: You can find a copy of this song rendered beautifully by Bing Crosby on his Bing Crosby s Greatest Hits CD, Track 7. You ve got to ac-cent-tchu-ate the
messages.messageBody:
You can find a copy of this song rendered beautifully by Bing Crosby on his Bing Crosby's Greatest Hits CD, Track 7.

You've got to ac-cent-tchu-ate the positive
E-lim-minate the negative
Latch on to the affirmative
Don't mess with mister in-between

You've go to spread joy up to the maximum
Bring gloom down to the minimum
Have faith or pandemonium
Liable to walk upon the scene

To illustrate
His last remark
Jonah in the whale
Noah in the Ark

What did they do
Just when everything looked so dark

Man they said we'd better
You've got to ac-cent-tchu-ate the positive
E-lim-minate the negative
Latch on to the affirmative
Don't mess with mister in-between

No, do not mess with mister in-between
Do you hear me, hum?

Oh listen to me children and you will hear
About the eliminatin of the negative
And an accent on the positive

Gather round me children if your willin
And sit tight while I start reviewin the attitude of doin right

You've got to ac-cent-tchu-ate the positive
E-lim-minate the negative
Latch on to the affirmative
Don't mess with mister in-between

You've go to spread joy up to the maximum
Bring gloom down to the minimum
Otherwise pandemonium
Liable to walk upon the scene

To illustrate (illustrate)
My last remark (you've got the floor)
Jonah in the whale
Noah in the Ark

What did they do
Just when everything looked so dark

Man they said we'd better
You've got to ac-cent-tchu-ate the positive
E-lim-minate the negative
Latch on to the affirmative
Don't mess with mister in-between

Don't mess with mister in-between

Enjoy - RJS
